sts remain i-cord tail using the remaining 2 sts work 6 row of i-cord make the tassel with your tapestry needle thread four 6-inch yarn strands through the final two i-cord s cid 415 tches to form the tassel centering your last 2 s cid 415 tches in the middle closing the i-cord tip to close the final two s cid 415 tches neatly over the 4 tassel strands cid 415 ghten them one at a cid 415 me use the cid 415 p of your needle or a tapestry needle to tug the le cid 332 s cid 415 tch first this closes the right s cid 415 tch then pull the tail to cid 415 ghten the le cid 332 s cid 415 tch cut the working yarn leaving an 8-inch tail wrap the tail firmly around the base of the i-cord to secure the tassel strands your badge is going to curl up like a croissant once it comes off the needles see page 3 for blocking or stabiliza cid 415 on cid 415 ps melt the ice badge 1 2 flat version free to share 2 fancy-schmancy instructions body of the badge co 16 sts in 1×1 rib work 6 row in 1×1 rib row 7 rs knit all sts row 8 ws purl all sts shaping the point row 9 rs ssk k12 k2tog 14 sts row 10 ws p2tog p10 slip 2 knitwise return them to the le cid 332 needle and p2tog tbl 12 sts row 11 rs ssk k8
